ps140: Lift up your eyes, О my soul,* and behold the dispensation and tender compassion of God:* how having bowed down the heavens,* He descended to the earth,* that He might raise you up from the wretched state of your passions,* and set you upon the rock of faith.* О, the wonder of this awesome miracle!* Glory to Your abasement, О Lover of mankind!

Behold your all-iniquitous works, О my soul,* and marvel that the earth still bears you, that it has not been driven asunder,* that the wild beasts do not devour you,* that the ever-shining Sun has not ceased to shine upon you.* Arise, repent, and cry out to the Lord:* I have sinned against You, I have sinned!* Have mercy on me!

Trusting in You, О omnipotent Lord, we beseech You,* that we be delivered from all tribulations, sufferings, and turmoil;* that we may pass our life in peace;* and, having lived in purity, may find You, our Master,* merciful on the day of judgment.
aposticha: As did the Prodigal Son, I also come to You, O compassionate one,* and I fall down before You.* Accept me as one of Your hired servants O God,* and have mercy on me, O Lover of mankind.

Like the man who fell among thieves and was wounded,* I also have fallen as a result of the multitude of sins,* and my soul has been grievously wounded.* To whom shall I, guilty as I am, flee for refuge,* if not to You, the merciful Physician of souls?* Pour upon me, O God, Your great mercy.
Glory to You, О Christ God,* boast of the apostles and joy of the martyrs,* who preached the consubstantial Trinity!
With the angel we cry out to you: Rejoice! O Bride of God,* calling you the bridal-chamber and portal,* the fiery throne and unquarried mountain,* and bush unconsumed.
